eller
i
alt
fald
vilde
hans
trusel
være
betydningsløs
da
protestanterne
fastholde
den
hibelske
sætning
al
de
chrislne
ere
et
folk
af
præster
at
lægmanden
ligesaavel
søm
den
geistlige
kan
sige
hvad
der
er
synd
og
ikke
synd
den
protestantiske
præst
giver
sig
ikke
ud
for
at
skulle
være
noget
mere
eller
noget
bedre
end
lægmanden
men

præst
staaer
i
et
ganske
andet
forhold
til
dem
der
ikke
ere

tjenere
den
ringeste

landsbypræst
staaer
paa
en
pjedestal
hvorfra
han
afgjer
hvad
der
er
synd
og
ikke

enhver

præstegaard

en

i
miniatur

bar
nøgler

til

og
til

i
den

eller

en

hin

truer

han

til

maae
ogsaa

al

i
„borgcrforcninfttns
lokale

masterade

a
country
swarming
with
enemies
the
little
column
of
colonel
greathed
has
penetrated
marching
almost
incessantly
for
1g
days
fighting
two
battles
—
not
to
apeak
of
smaller
actions
—
and
destroying
several
thousands
of
the
enemy
such
achievements
speak
for
themselves
we
must
now
turn
to
lucknow
the
position
of
the
british
commander
is
singular
between
the
20th
and
25th
of
september
general
llavelock
hail
marched
from
cawnpore
to
luck
now
with
a
force
numbering
less
than
2
800
men
the
lighting
during
the
march
was
not
considerable
considering
the
number
of
the
enemy
and
the
weakness
of
oar
force
the
mutineers
however
had
thrown
up
works
at
a
place
called
allumbagh
three
miles
short
of
lucknow
these
were
mounted
with
50
guns
and
were
taken
after
a
stubborn
resistance
by
general
havelock
finding
the
place
of
sufficient
strength
the
general
left
a
party
of
the
64th
in
it
with
the
sick
and
wounded
ami
himself
pushed
on
to
lucknow
a
plain
traversed
by
a
road

separates
lucknow
from
allumbagh
and
as
havelock
crossed
the
bridge
over
the
canal
it
was
broken
down
behind
him
by
the
enemy
who
bung
upon
his
rear
then
followed
the
attack
on
lucknow
which
was
partially
taken
with
a
loss
on
our
aide
of
about
goo
killed
and
wounded
tile
residency
was
relieved
and
general
havelock
established
himself
there
then
follows
the
strange
part
of
the
story
the
rebels
have
placed
themselves
on
the
plain
between
the
main
body
of
knglish
and
the
party
of
the
g4th
which
holds
allumbagh
the
whole

of
country
between

and

is
clear
and
a
quantity
of
provisions
convoyed
by
only
250
men
has
got
in
with

but
to
lucknow
itself
